messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] un-shopping was: sick commercials ...
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 09/06/2000 2:07:59 PM !!!First Boot!!!, valeries@whyweb.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 09/06/2000 2:07:59 PM !!!First Boot!!!,
valeries@... writes:

<<
"For a science experiment, Mom." She's 5 1/2 so pretty much the whole world
is a science experiment.

Nance,

My daughters love their turkey baster, too. But my 8 yo says it's for her
"Science experiments gone terribly wrong" (using very dramatic voice).
Sometimes I wonder if the leftover liquid should be considered hazardous
waste.

---Valerie

>>


Oh my!!

Nance

messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] un-shopping was: sick commercials ...
messages.msgSnippet: For a science experiment, Mom.  She s 5 1/2 so pretty much the whole world is a science experiment. Nance, My daughters love their turkey baster, too. But my
messages.messageBody:
"For a science experiment, Mom." She's 5 1/2 so pretty much the whole world
is a science experiment.

Nance,

My daughters love their turkey baster, too. But my 8 yo says it's for her
"Science experiments gone terribly wrong" (using very dramatic voice).
Sometimes I wonder if the leftover liquid should be considered hazardous
waste.

---Valerie

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] un-shopping was: sick commercials ...
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 09/06/2000 9:09:40 AM !!!First Boot!!!, cathie_98@hotmail.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 09/06/2000 9:09:40 AM !!!First Boot!!!,
cathie_98@... writes:

<< Well, they should take pictures of the kidlets when we "un" school shop. >>


Ooh, ooh -- this reminds me of my daughter.

We were in the supermarket the other day. She saw a turkey baster and just
HAD to have it!

"For a science experiment, Mom." She's 5 1/2 so pretty much the whole world
is a science experiment.

But that was a pretty good $1.89 to spend. She has since used it for several
"projects" and had great fun!

Nance
